Description (from Viome): This score focuses on your gut lining (or intestinal barrier) and the health of the mucosal layer that protects it.
This score assesses the levels of activity of all microbial pathways leading to the production of LPS (lipopolysaccharides) in your gut.
This score assesses the levels of all activity of all metabolic pathways that suggest a pro-inflammatory or hostile environment in the gut.
This score assesses microbial activities in the gut that result in the production of TMA (trimethylamine).
This score assesses the levels of activity of all microbial pathways that are associated with the production of ammonia.
This score represents active microbial organisms and functions that are associated with your blood sugar, insulin resistance, or weight control.
This score is your percentile for the total count of active microbial species detected and sequenced from your stool sample.
This score assesses the levels of activity of all microbial pathways that lead to the production of a beneficial nutrient - butyrate.
This score assesses microbial activities related to the production of flagella.
This score assesses the levels of activity of all microbial pathways that lead to putrescine production.
This score assesses the level of activity of microbial pathways that lead to the production and degradation of uric acid (or urate) in the gut.
This score assesses the levels of activity of gut microbial pathways involved in the metabolism of bile acids.
This score measures the activities of your microbes that can contribute to or reflect inflammation in your gut environment.
Your gut microbiome is home to trillions of microbes that have a direct influence on everything from how you digest foods to how your immune system responds to infections or allergens.
This score is a comprehensive microbial reflection of your gastrointestinal (GI) tract functions.
This score reflects whether or not you are digesting your proteins properly.
This score is an assessment of your overall gas production activity by the microbes in your gut.
This score assesses the level of activity of microbial pathways that result in the production of methane gas in the gut.
This score assesses the levels of activity of all microbial pathways that result in the production of hydrogen sulfide gas.
This score assesses the level of activity of gut microbial pathways needed to break down or metabolize oxalates.
This score assesses the levels of activity of all microbial pathways that signal excessive salt in the gut environment.
Your Microbiome-Induced Stress score offers insights about those microbial activities that can lead to stress or inflammatory response not only in your gut, but also in your body.
